intro: Berberis recurvata, commonly known as the Himalayan barberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central and South Asia. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically dark green in color. The plant produces yellow flowers in early spring, followed by red or orange berries that are edible but often bitter. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
